CONJUGATES: unlawfully | unlawfulness | more unlawful | most unlawful
ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English, formed by prefixing un- (negative) to lawful. Lawful derives from law (Old English lagu, Old Norse lǫg) + -ful.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Not conforming to, authorized by, or permitted by law; illegal.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 违反法律的；不合法的；非法的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The police confirmed that possession of the stolen goods was unlawful.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 警方确认，持有这些赃物是非法的。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Not morally right or just; unethical or wrongful.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 不公正的；不道德的；非正义的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: It is an unlawful practice to deny basic rights to any citizen.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 剥夺任何公民的基本权利是一种不公正的做法。
